Properties

override bool CanReset [get]
 Gets a value indicating whether the XorShiftRandomSource can be reset, so that it produces the same pseudo-random number sequence again.

Detailed Description

Represents a xorshift pseudo-random number generator with period 2^128-1.

The XorShiftRandomSource type bases upon the implementation presented in the CP article "<a href="http://www.codeproject.com/csharp/fastrandom.asp">A fast equivalent for System.Random</a>" and the theoretical background on xorshift random number generators published by George Marsaglia in this paper "<a href="http://www.jstatsoft.org/v08/i14/xorshift.pdf">Xorshift RNGs</a>".

MathNet.Numerics.RandomSources.XorShiftRandomSource.XorShiftRandomSource ( int  seed  ) 

Initializes a new instance of the XorShiftRandomSource class, using the specified seed value.

Parameters:
seed A number used to calculate a starting value for the pseudo-random number sequence. If a negative number is specified, the absolute value of the number is used.

Member Function Documentation

override int MathNet.Numerics.RandomSources.XorShiftRandomSource.Next (  )  [virtual]

Returns a nonnegative random number less than Int32.MaxValue.

Returns:
A 32-bit signed integer greater than or equal to 0, and less than Int32.MaxValue; that is, the range of return values includes 0 but not Int32.MaxValue .

Implements MathNet.Numerics.RandomSources.RandomSource.

Definition at line 265 of file XorShiftRandomSource.cs.

override int MathNet.Numerics.RandomSources.XorShiftRandomSource.Next ( int  maxValue  )  [virtual]

Returns a nonnegative random number less than the specified maximum.

Parameters:
maxValue The exclusive upper bound of the random number to be generated. maxValue must be greater than or equal to 0.
Returns:
A 32-bit signed integer greater than or equal to 0, and less than maxValue ; that is, the range of return values includes 0 but not maxValue .
Exceptions:
ArgumentOutOfRangeException maxValue is less than 0.

Implements MathNet.Numerics.RandomSources.RandomSource.

Definition at line 303 of file XorShiftRandomSource.cs.

override int MathNet.Numerics.RandomSources.XorShiftRandomSource.Next ( int  minValue,
int  maxValue 
) [virtual]

Returns a random number within the specified range.

Parameters:
minValue The inclusive lower bound of the random number to be generated.
maxValue The exclusive upper bound of the random number to be generated. maxValue must be greater than or equal to minValue .
Returns:
A 32-bit signed integer greater than or equal to minValue , and less than maxValue ; that is, the range of return values includes minValue but not maxValue . If minValue equals maxValue , minValue is returned.
Exceptions:
ArgumentOutOfRangeException minValue is greater than maxValue .

Implements MathNet.Numerics.RandomSources.RandomSource.

Definition at line 303 of file XorShiftRandomSource.cs.

override bool MathNet.Numerics.RandomSources.XorShiftRandomSource.NextBoolean (  )  [virtual]

Returns a random Boolean value.

Buffers 32 random bits (1 uint) for future calls, so a new random number is only generated every 32 calls.

Returns:
A Boolean value.

Implements MathNet.Numerics.RandomSources.RandomSource.

Returns a random Boolean value.

Buffers 32 random bits (1 uint) for future calls, so a new random number is only generated every 32 calls.

Returns:
A Boolean value.

Definition at line 541 of file XorShiftRandomSource.cs.

override void MathNet.Numerics.RandomSources.XorShiftRandomSource.NextBytes ( byte[]  buffer  )  [virtual]

Fills the elements of a specified array of bytes with random numbers.

Each element of the array of bytes is set to a random number greater than or equal to 0, and less than or equal to Byte.MaxValue.

Parameters:
buffer An array of bytes to contain random numbers.
Exceptions:
ArgumentNullException buffer is a null reference ( in Visual Basic).

Implements MathNet.Numerics.RandomSources.RandomSource.

override double MathNet.Numerics.RandomSources.XorShiftRandomSource.NextDouble ( double  maxValue  )  [virtual]

Returns a nonnegative floating point random number less than the specified maximum.

Parameters:
maxValue The exclusive upper bound of the random number to be generated. maxValue must be greater than or equal to 0.0.
Returns:
A double-precision floating point number greater than or equal to 0.0, and less than maxValue ; that is, the range of return values includes 0 but not maxValue .
Exceptions:
ArgumentOutOfRangeException maxValue is less than 0.

Definition at line 399 of file XorShiftRandomSource.cs.

override double MathNet.Numerics.RandomSources.XorShiftRandomSource.NextDouble ( double  minValue,
double  maxValue 
) [virtual]

Returns a floating point random number within the specified range.

Parameters:
minValue The inclusive lower bound of the random number to be generated. The range between minValue and maxValue must be less than or equal to Double.MaxValue
maxValue The exclusive upper bound of the random number to be generated. maxValue must be greater than or equal to minValue . The range between minValue and maxValue must be less than or equal to Double.MaxValue.
Returns:
A double-precision floating point number greater than or equal to minValue , and less than maxValue ; that is, the range of return values includes minValue but not maxValue . If minValue equals maxValue , minValue is returned.
Exceptions:
ArgumentOutOfRangeException minValue is greater than maxValue .
ArgumentException The range between minValue and maxValue is greater than Double.MaxValue.

Implements MathNet.Numerics.RandomSources.RandomSource.
